profileAlternative.name: Wayne Pinnell
profileAlternative.headline: Auditor by Training. Business Advisor by Evolution.
profileAlternative.summary:
I got my initial work experience in a simple enough manner - delivering daily newspapers on my bicycle in a small town in New Jersey. When I turned 16, I went to work at the local McDonald's while I finished high school and studied accounting in college. I gained a lot of valuable experience from McD's managing people and providing customer service. After college, I began my public accounting career at Seidman & Seidman (which since changed to BDO Seidman and is now known as BDO USA). In November 1995, I joined Haskell & White LLP, a regional CPA firm in Orange County, California. In July 2004, I became the Managing Partner of the Firm and continue to serve in that capacity as well as serving as an audit partner for public, private and non-profit entities. Besides being an auditor, I have honed my skills as a business advisor helping my clients improve their operational and financial results; and preparing them for future business and personal succession.

I serve on the boards for several not-for-profit entities including Laura's House, Boys & Girls Clubs of Central Orange Coast and the Orange County Sheriff's Advisory Council and its related entity, Drug Use is Life Abuse. I have also been teaching auditing to undergraduates part-time at California State University, Fullerton since 2002 and serve on a number of boards at CSUF including the Center For Corporate Governance & Reporting, the Executive Council, and the Department of Accounting Advisory Board.

Specialties: Audit and business consulting for small to large organizations both privately and publicly-held. Industries: manufacturing, distribution, retail, real estate, and technology (from software to peripherals to medical devices to bio-tech). My favorite service areas today are in SEC reporting, M&A, and general business consulting to assist with growth & profit enhancement, as well as transnational matters.

positions.title: Managing Partner
positions.description: As the Managing Partner of Haskell & White, I oversee the overall strategic direction and operations of the Firm, while continuing to serve public and private company clients in my role as an audit and business advisory services partner. I also enjoy working with companies as an advisor to help them with their overall growth and profit strategies and preparing for succession/transactional opportunities.

positions.title: Founding Member / Advisor
positions.description:
The Center For Business Growth’s mission is to create an interactive community of Owners and C-Level Executives of entrepreneurial mid-size companies in Southern California that will provide these business leaders with the opportunity to engage in interactive educational forums with other business leaders to learn best practices from each other as well as a faculty of professionals from disciplines ranging from legal, accounting,marketing, branding, sales, research and executive peer learning.
…
see more

positions.title: Partner
positions.description: I started my career at BDO first as an intern while in college in the NYC office; then as a full-time staff initially in Los Angeles. When the firm acquired a practice in Orange County, I switched offices as the OC location was closer to my home. I then progressed through the ranks and became a partner in July 1995.

positions.title: Swing Manager
positions.description: Part-time job through high school and college. The experience gave me opportunities to learn fromthe ground up from cooking to register to even the janitorial duties! After one-year, I became the trainer for the store and then a manager./ great opportunites to work with people - both employees and customers.

given.text: Wayne is a very entrepreneurial CPA. No, that's not a self-canceling phrase! I love all the different ways Wayne is helping to build community in O.C.!

Wayne Pinnell was Audit Partner when I first started working for Haskell & White; Soon after became Managing Partner. My 3+ years of experience with Wayne Pinnell revealed to me that he was as honest, reliable, and knowledgeable as they come.

Wayne (Professor Pinnell as I know him) was one of the best teachers I've had to date. He was able to make traditionally dry subjects; auditing and accounting, into engaging subjects which reminded me why I love accounting. During my time as his student I asked plenty of questions and he answered them all in a manner that exhibited expertise and experience. He was one of my favorite educators and although my career path is in tax, he almost had me considering audit. His passion and professionalism is an example of what all educators should strive for.
…
See more
Wayne is committed to every project he is involved in. He is an amazing fund raiser and a passionate and dedicated ambassador for Laura's House. We are very fortunate to have him on our team!

Wayne and I have shared several public company clients over the years (me being the lawyer and Wayne being the auditor) with great success. In a couple of cases, my public company client wanted to move from a Big 4 firm to a regional firm and Wayne was the perfect fit and they were quite happy. He is my go to referral for middle market companies in need of an auditor.
…
See more

received.text: Gary McArdell and Chon Kantikovit represented Haskell & White in its recent renewal of its office in Irvine Spectrum, CA. Gary and Chon's focus on our firm's goals and objectives in combination with a deep experience in negotiating with the Irvine Company, provided our firm with innovated and customize solutions throughout the negotiation process. This is the second successful real estate negotiation within the last 7 years in which Chon and Gary have represented our firm.
